titleStmt.title: The Quakers prophesie: or, Strange and wonderful news from Spittle-Fields, humbly dedicated to the Queen of Poland. To the tune of, Then covetousness out of England will run.
The Quakers prophesie: or, Strange and wonderful news from Spittle-Fields, humbly dedicated to the Queen of Poland. To the tune of, Then covetousness out of England will run.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Absalon [sic] Chamerlain, in Red-bull Play-house-yard over against the pound in St. John-street; near Clerken-well-green.,

notesStmt.note: Date of publication suggested by Wing (2nd ed.).
Second column headed: A new song called Love in a tub. To a new tune called, Daniel Cooper.
Love in a tub is listed as Wing N758.
First line of Quakers prophesie: Come all my kind neighbours and listen awhile.
First line of New song called Love in a tub: A female Quaker in Cheap-side.
Reproduction of original in: National Library of Scotland--Crawford Collections.
